item.title: Aukus: Australia defends role in security pact amid French condemnation
item.description: The PM defends ending the multi-billion dollar agreement in favour of a new pact with the US and UK.

item.title: Giving birth under the Taliban
item.description: Pregnant women, new mothers and infants are bearing the brunt of a worsening healthcare crisis.

item.title: Afghanistan: Stay home, female Kabul government workers told
item.description: It is the latest restriction imposed on Afghanistan's women by the country's new Taliban rulers.

item.title: Climate change: The world awaits India's net zero emission deadline
item.description: US climate envoy John Kerry failed to get a commitment from Delhi during his recent visit.

item.title: My husband and son fought in Afghanistan - it changed all of us
item.description: America's two decades in Afghanistan impacted those who served - and the families waiting at home.

item.title: Turkmenistan: Getting Covid in a land where no cases officially exist
item.description: People in Turkmenistan are struggling to get treatment in a system that denies there are any cases.

item.title: Afghanistan: Girls excluded as Afghan secondary schools reopen
item.description: "Everything looks very dark," a schoolgirl tells the BBC as schools reopen for boys but not girls.

item.title: Hyderabad rape suspect found dead: Is it murder or suicide?
item.description: Police say the 30-year-old man raped and killed a child in the city of Hyderabad last week.

item.title: Manny Pacquiao: Boxing star to run for Philippines president
item.description: Manny Pacquiao is a senator in parliament and remains active in the ring after a successful career.

item.title: Covid vaccine: India gives 20 million jabs to mark PM Modi's birthday
item.description: The country is trying to ramp up vaccination to stave off a third wave of Covid-19.

item.title: Astronauts return to Earth after China's longest space mission
item.description: The three astronauts spent 90 days at China's space station, some 380km above Earth.

item.title: Harsh Mander: Outcry as Indian authorities search activist's premises
item.description: Officials searched three locations linked to Harsh Mander, a prominent critic of PM Modi's government.

item.title: Thailand Covid: Idle taxis used to grow food for out-of-work drivers
item.description: With Thailand's capital under tight Covid restrictions, taxis are being repurposed to grow food.

item.title: China applies to join key Asia-Pacific trade pact
item.description: It comes the day after a regional security agreement between the US, UK and Australia was unveiled.

item.title: Afghanistan: The escape of the whirling dancer
item.description: How the only female whirling dancer in Afghanistan made it out of Kabul.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'shattered dreams' of the Ariana cabin crew
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet meets the female crew of Afghanistan's national airline, who are in hiding.

item.title: 'Thereâ€™s security but no money': Afghans settle into life under Taliban rule
item.description: In Mazar-i-Sharif, former army pilots are flying Taliban around and families are selling possessions for food.

item.title: Why North Korea's cruise missile launch could worry other nations
item.description: Though cruise missiles are not banned by the UN, this test presents new problems for other nations.

item.title: Afghanistan: Life under Taliban rule one month on
item.description: Secunder Kermani looks at life in northern Afghanistan, four weeks after the militants seized power.

item.title: Covid: The lives upended by Australia's sealed border
item.description: Eighteen months after Australia shut its border, people reveal tales of separation and despair.

item.title: Pakistan: How to cool Karachi as temperatures rise
item.description: In Karachi, Pakistan, one entrepreneur is on a mission to plant urban forests to cope with rising temperatures.
